isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - REASSEMBLE - INTEGRAL SLAVE GEARS

svcproc.title: INTEGRAL SLAVE GEARS
svcproc.para: On reassembly, the timing marks on the piston rack and the pinion gear must be carefully timed.
Some Series 5 and all Series 6 slave gear models use seal rings on the ends of the power piston ( Figure 95).

figure.caption: Figure 95. Some Series 5 and All Series 6 Slave Gears Use Seal Rings on Ends of Power Piston

step1.para: New seals are installed by placing the O-ring expander in the piston groove and installing the square cut seal ring over it ( Figure 96).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Place O-Ring Expander in Piston Groove

step1.para: You will have to carefully work the piston ring past the pinion gear opening in the cylinder bore. While maintaining pressure on the end of the piston, use the blunt end of a wooden stick to press the piston seal into the ring groove. As the piston ring is compressed into the ring groove, the piston will slide further into the bore until the piston ring has passed the pinion gear opening ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Work Piston Ring Past Pinion Gear Opening

note.para: Due to the nature of the seal material, it will stretch as it is fitted to the ring groove. If you let the piston set with the seal rings in place, they will contract and it will become easier to install it in the piston bore.
